text: Tor «Jern-Gustav» Gundersen (September 15, 1935 - September 13, 2012) was a Norwegian ice hockey player. He played for the Norwegian national ice hockey team, and participated at the Winter Olympics in 1964 and in 1968. He was awarded Gullpucken as best Norwegian ice hockey player in 1960. He was a playing head coach for Vålerenga Ishockey during the team's golden age in the 1960s and has ten championships in his name. ==References== ==External links== *Tor Gundersen's obituary Category:1935 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Ice hockey players at the 1964 Winter Olympics Category:Ice hockey players at the 1968 Winter Olympics Category:Norwegian ice hockey players Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Norway Category:Sportspeople from Oslo
title: Tor Gundersen
